content.text:
# Your Job

Scan https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw, https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw, and https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot for new tools, skills, and architectures. Pick the best new idea and actually WRITE the code to implement it as a new PopeBot skill in your sandbox (.pi/skills/). Write and execute a test to prove it works. Use the send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com a progress report detailing what you built, how you implemented it, your test results, and code samples so the user can review it at 8 AM.

content.thinking:
This is a comprehensive task. I need to:

1. Scan three GitHub repositories for new tools, skills, and architectures
2. Pick the best new idea
3. Implement it as a new PopeBot skill in the sandbox (.pi/skills/)
4. Write and execute a test to prove it works
5. Send an email progress report to winsorllc@yahoo.com

Let me start by exploring the repositories. I'll use the browser-tools skill to scan these GitHub repos, or I could clone them and examine the code. Let me first check what's already in the current environment and then explore the repos.

Let me start by checking the current structure and then use bash to clone and explore the repositories.

content.text: I'll scan the three repositories for new tools, skills, and architectures, then implement the best idea as a new PopeBot skill. Let me start by exploring these repositories.

arguments.command: mkdir -p /job/tmp/repo-scan && cd /job/tmp/repo-scan && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw.git zeroclaw 2>&1 | head -20

content.thinking: Good, let me continue cloning the other repositories.

arguments.command: cd /job/tmp/repo-scan && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw.git openclaw 2>&1 | head -20

content.thinking: Good, let me continue cloning the repositories.
Good, all three repos are cloned. Let me explore their structures to find new tools, skills, and architectures.
